<answer>



That's not subjective to opinions at ALL.
Hmm, let's see. One of the best bands ever, and I am not using this term loosely, is Muse. (They have quite the fitting name.) In my opinion, their best album overall is "Origin of Symmetry", but "Absolution" is very good as well.
My favorite band is My Chemical Romance; mostly for emotional reasons, but I digress.
-looks through favorites on iTunes-
Oh, and if you don't mind digging through Limewire, Porcelain and the Tramps aren't too shabby. Emilie Autumn does a gorgeous blend of industrial and classical. Marilyn Manson doesn't really have any bad songs, methinks. Nine Inch Nails have made a good bunch of my favorite songs. t.A.T.u. (or however you capitalize it)...Yeah Yeah Yeahs (extremely loud live)...Hot Chip...David Bowie...Lil Wayne...it all depends on your musical tastes, bro.



Source(s):



The aforementioned iTunes :p

<question>



What's the genre of children of bodom?



they have the traits of power metal and death metal....what is it really???is there a genre called power death metal???



</question>



<answer from>



red'n'pu...
Member since: 04 November 2007
Total points: 851 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Everything is possible, we live in 21st century,not before the 50s of 20th century, so the genres and the styles are not very clear.



</answer>



<answer from>



x_The Poison_x
Member since: 13 December 2007
Total points: 4630 (Level 4)



Contributing In:



Rock and Pop



</answer from>



<answer>



I dunno, if we're gonna resort to pesky subgenres I would call them melodic death. But what's wrong with just "metal"?



</answer>



<answer from>



Mike S
Member since: 31 October 2008
Total points: 109 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



There is some contention regarding the band's genre classification, but in general the band's musical style can be described as a cross between melodic death metal and power metal.



Source(s):



http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Children_of...



</answer>

and he knows nothing.
NOTHING!!!

<question>



Ticket Touts!!!!!!!!!! ?



Why don't ebay do something about people that put sold out tickets up for sale at excessive prices just minutes after tickets have went on sale/sold out!?  it's very frustrating for the fans, I wanted 3 tickets for Take That and could only get 2 this morning.  Now if I want the extra ticket I will have to pay over twice the price to get it to someone who had no intention of going in the first place.  It is shocking and something should be done.



</question>



<additional details>



The question is why isn't anyone doing anything about it?  Surely they can put policies in place.



</additional details>



<answer from>



kimie
Member since: 07 October 2008
Total points: 220 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



this isn't really a question is it? it is a rant.
as much as i feel for you and agree
stop moaning on here and do something about it
pressure groups



</answer>



<answer from>



col
Member since: 09 September 2008
Total points: 2782 (Level 4)



</answer from>



<answer>



Dont buy from touts.People like you keep them in business.Sorry but thats the only way to stop them.



</answer>



<answer from>



A A*s Pocket of Whiskey
Member since: 16 April 2008
Total points: 1494 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



Capitalism. It benefits eBay when that happens, it benefits the sellers when that happens and it doesn't hurt the band. Why should eBay create a policy that is difficult to uphold solely to help actual fans of bands over entrepreneurs when it would in fact hurt them.



This is not an anti-capitalistic rant. I have nothing wrong with the scalpers.



</answer>

<category>



Entertainment & Music

<question from>



jane
Member since: 17 December 2006
Total points: 1489 (Level 3)



</question from>



<question>



Anyone knows how to translate the lyrics of this song?



i just love the song "tu hi tu mera dost hain" from the film "yuvvraj"..can anyone translate the whole song?



</question>



<answer from>



Robert M
Member since: 31 August 2008
Total points: 1110 (Level 3)



</answer from>



<answer>



tu hi tu mera dost hain



translates as



who let the dogs out



</answer>



<answer from>



wicked
Member since: 09 June 2006
Total points: 454 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



Singer – Runa



Tadka reader Asma requested the English translation of the song ‘Jaane Tu Mera Kya Hai’ from Jaane Tu Ya Jaane! Enjoy the lyrics



jaane tu mera kya hai…
(I don’t know how much you mean to me…)
jaane tu mera kya tha…
(I don’t know how much you meant so far…)
tu hi mera har pal…
(you were in my each moment…)
tu hi har lamha tha…
(you were in my each memory…)



jaane kaisi kashish hai…
(I don’t know what kinda wish is this…)
jaane kaisi khalish hai…
(I don’t know what irks me these days…)
kyun ye saansein thami hain…
(why these breaths have ceased nowadays…)
aankhon mein kyun nami hai…
(and why these eyes remain moist …)



hai ye dosti humko yaheen tha…
(I was sure that this was friendship…)
dosti aur kuch bhi nahi tha…
(friendship, and nothing more than that…)
hai ye kaisa dard nayaa sa…
(what kind of new pain is this now?…)
kyun dil lagta toota toota,
(why the heart seems so shattered these days…)



jaana, dil jaana, kaise maine na jaana…
(love, my love, I can’t know why I never knew…)
ke pyaar yahi hai…
(that this was love indeed…)
ye jaane tu, ya jaane na…
(whether you knew it or not…)



jaana, dil jaana, kaise tune na jaana…
(love, my love, hoe come you never knew it…)
ye pyaar hi hai…
(that this indeed was love…)
haan jaane tu, ya jaane .. na…
(whether you knew it or didn’t…)



jaane tu mera kya hai…
jaane tu mera kya tha…
tu hi mera har pal…
tu hi har lamha tha…



ho….
hoti thi tujhse subha har din ki…
(each day’s morning used to start with you…)
teri dopahar se shaam ki dhun thi…
(you were the tunes from the noons to the evenings…)
hoti thi raatein teri baahon mein khoye…
(and the nights were spent lying in your arms…)
tere khayaalon mein hi jaage aur soye…
(you were in my thoughts, whether in slee or  while awake…)



tu jo nahi to kya, rahaa…
(now that you aren’t there, nothing remains…)



umm mm… hmm mm…



jaane tu mera kya hai…
jaane tu mera kya tha…
tu hi mera har pal…
tu hi har lamha tha…



jaane kaisi kashish hai…
jaane kaisi khalish hai…
kyun ye saansein thami hain…
aankhon mein kyun nami hai…



jaana, dil jaana, kaise maine na jaana…
ke pyaar yahi hai…
ye jaane tu, ya jaane na…



jaana, dil jaana, kaise tune na jaana…
ye pyaar hi hai…
haan jaane tu, ya jaane .. na…
haan jaane tu, ya jaane .. na…



Source(s):



Lyrics on demand - English translation of the song ‘Jaane Tu Mera Kya Hai’ from the movie Jaane Tu Ya Jaane Na



</answer>



<answer from>



naughtyd...
Member since: 02 August 2008
Total points: 59 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>

</answer>

<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>

<answer from>



David V
Member since: 11 July 2008
Total points: 6933 (Level 5)



Contributing In:



Rock and Pop



</answer from>



<answer>



I love that song as I do most of his work and when he was part of the Walker Brothers.
The Walker Brothers 1960's to 1970's
Founded by three Californians, who became most successful in the UK
They were not related, and adopted the Walker Brothers name as a show business touch.
Scott Walker.....born Noel Scott Engel 9 Jan. 1943, Hamilton, Ohio, Leadd vocalist, bassist.
Gary Walker.......born Gary Leeds, 3 Sept. 1942, Glendale, California, drummer, vocalist.
John Walker......12 Nov. 1943, New York, guitarist, vocalist.



All three continued to release solo records, with Scott being by far the



most successful. In 1976 the group unexpectedly reunited, scoring another UK top ten hit with Tom Rush's, No Regrets. However the three
albums that followed sold poorly. Scott's tracks on the final album Nite
Flights, laid the stylistic grounwork for Scott's later solo career.



Check out the Sun Ain't Going Shine Anymore [March 1966 #1Hit] you will love this song.
Take Care



Dave



</answer>



<answer from>



Fonzie T
Member since: 20 May 2006
Total points: 42096 (Level 7)



Contributing In:



Rock and Pop



</answer from>

<question from>



none
Member since: 30 April 2008
Total points: 164 (Level 1)



</question from>



<question>



How to write a lyric?



my bf had made me a song without lyric.
he asked me to do it for him.
my questions are:
1) is writing a lyric is the same as writing a poem?



2) is there any tips in writing lyrics?



cause, i prefer to write a lyric that is not straight to the point.



thank you for your time.



</question>



<answer from>



wnrox
Member since: 30 October 2008
Total points: 175 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



try to write down what inspires you, or what you feel. look around you and be aware of your surroundings, perhaps you might get some idea. it comes naturally



</answer>



<answer from>



Casiquire Z
Member since: 31 October 2008
Total points: 110 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Writing a lyric is really similar to writing a poem but you have to consider what would sound good within the song.  In lyrics, you can bend some rules that you can't really bend in poetry.  You can break away from your rhyme scheme, for example, or hold out one syllable for a few beats.  The hardest part is really making it fit the music and sound good in song.



</answer>



<answer from>



purplean...
Member since: 04 August 2007
Total points: 193 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



just listen to your heart



</answer>

<answer from>



seelisil...
Member since: 18 September 2008
Total points: 260 (Level 2)



</answer from>



<answer>



i have that same prob..i asked that before and what most of them suggested was limewire..it is peer to peer..i try it from time to time..if you do, be careful coz there are lots of virus there..make sure you scan first after you download ur music...try spiralfrog..i guess its better than limewire.



</answer>



<answer from>



irishkwe...
Member since: 31 October 2008
Total points: 105 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



I found that music tracks.com is cool and new members (after a very short survey) are awarded 1000 free downloads and after using it for about 3 weeks i still  have not gotten any viruses from it!



try it you'll like it.



Source(s):



got it from a link from frosty games.com

<question>

<answer from>



R_e_D
Member since: 29 October 2008
Total points: 133 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



<evaluation>Best Answer - Chosen by Asker</evaluation>



u u u uu
aaaaaa
uuuuuu



a la adversidad hay q enfrentarla
la felicidad hay ganarla
para triunfar saber ser fuerte
es lo fundamentaal
junta el valor para alcanzar
a esos sueños q se ven lejanos
pero creeme q esto
muy pronto se hara realidad
hay tantas cosas x delante
ten cuidado q no fallen
si el camino se hace duro
tu le ganas segurooo
vuelen alto muchachitas
las estrellas van a alcanzar
talentosas muchachitas
lo q kieran lo podran lograr
vuelen alto muchachitas
las estrellas van a alcanzar
talentosas muchachitas
todo lo q kieran lo podran lograr



y se repite todo otra vez



Source(s):



I THINK



</answer>

<answer from>



xemza
Member since: 19 October 2008
Total points: 216 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



OMFG.
FAVOURITE BAND EVER.
At the beginning of the year when they got back together they played at the New Zealand Big Day Out.
BEST DAY OF MY LIFE - they put on a damn good show.



Guerilla Radio is my fav.
BECAUSE it was the first song I ever heard from them.

</answer>



<answer from>



dirtysme...
Member since: 27 October 2008
Total points: 126 (Level 1)



</answer from>



<answer>



Love em.
Powerful music that makes you want to get up and stand up for your beliefs.



My favorite song is hard to say. All their songs are great, yet many seem to overlap in my mind. Renegades of Funk is one of my favorites, although it is not as highly looked upon by Rage fans as other great tracks.



Recently I saw them at Lollapalooza which was an very energetic and intense show. The crowd was getting so pumped up and crazy that Zach had to stop the set on numerous occasions to have everyone step back as to not have people get hurt. They still have energy but doesn't seem as much as when they were together the first time. I guess that's them getting older though. I'd highly recommend seeing them if you can.



I haven't heard anything about them touring or working on any new material but that would sure be awesome.



Keep rocking on man!



</answer>



<answer from>

Member since: 06 February 2008
Total points: 6760 (Level 5)
